metadata.titel_preek: On Not Winning the Heisman Trophy

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Yahweh redefines 'glory' by choosing vulnerable connection with needy people over self-assertive power and applause.

tekstueel_bewijs: Yahweh goes to be with these folks

object.identificatie: A redefined 'Glory' (characterized by grace, truth, and connection)
tekstueel_bewijs: My real glory... comes from these treasured connections
Glory is gotten... by giving new life to folks
J, however, introduces Yahweh’s precious relatedness

ontvanger.identificatie: The needy (Israelites, three-year-olds, feeble fathers, sinners)
tekstueel_bewijs: fearful slaves and the frightened peasants
widows and orphans, and publicans and sinners
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of God's attention and then as a Subject in the image of this God.

helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who possesses these attributes.

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Glory Script' of the World (Pharaoh, NFL Linemen, Self-assertion)
tekstueel_bewijs: the triumphs coveted by the other gods
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is a cultural paradigm of power that God must resist within His own character.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response: living in the image of this connected God.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon moves from God's character (Primary) to the human image (Secondary).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: The Gospel → Redefined Glory → The Needy

voorbeelden_god_subject: Yahweh goes to be with these folks
The Lord will fight for you
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We saw how good he is
We are not made in the image of a God who just sacks Pharaoh

voorbeelden: he must take his beloved three-year-old to the bathroom
Yahweh would love the applause... On the other hand, Yahweh completely redefines glory
Ponder this first: Yahweh struggles for a new notion of glory
The Lord will fight for you, you have only to keep still

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'will' and 'desire'—His choice to be connected rather than aloof.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (The expected glory) to S1 (The cross-shaped glory) via the negation of S2 (leaving the field).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Glory is found in the 'low' place (S1) rather than the 'high' place (S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is portrayed as highly attractive but ultimately empty.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor who initiates the change in the definition of glory. Humans are receivers of this 'fidelity' before being called to reflect it.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The glory to which we are invited... is of another sort... committed, caring

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the Subject of Rescue
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord will fight for you, you have only to keep still.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Grace as the endowment of competence
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Full of what you can count on, if you are three years old or feeble.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Israelites) are shown as helpless, not as models of virtue.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God is the one who 'leaves the field' for us.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and security in God's reliability.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification by grace through the 'connectedness' of God.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The metaphor of the NFL lineman is masterfully integrated with the Exodus and Johannine texts.
spanning_punten: The tension between God's desire for 'applause' and His 'commitment' is a bold anthropomorphism.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: This is a connected God who is never without the folks.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the Father/Son's reliability (Emeth).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully places God as the Subject of the primary narrative program. The 'Object' is not human performance, but a new reality of 'Glory' defined by God's presence.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Slightly more Pouvoir (How God's grace enables the hearer).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Expand on how 'grace and truth' actually empowers the 'feeble' to walk.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent is mostly a 'script' or 'culture'.
tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Frame the 'Glory of Pharaoh' as a more destructive, enslaving power.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Deepens the necessity of the Subject-switch to Yahweh.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's glory) clearly precedes Ethics (Our image).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A brilliant example of theocentric preaching that uses a secular metaphor to subvert human pride and exalt God's fidelity.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the NFL metaphor's effectiveness; Greimas shows how the metaphor reassigns the 'Subject' role from Man to God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains J vs P; Greimas shows how J changes the 'Axis of Desire' from self-glory to relatedness.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Heisman' is the Opponent actant—a value system that God must overcome to reach the Receiver.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'If-Then' trap of moralism.
